intro: Siphocampylus aurocinctus, commonly known as the golden girdled larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers and hairy, glandular stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in dry, sunny environments. Its leaves are alternate and have a distinctive glandular texture, contributing to its unique botanical appearance. The species is part of the tribe Lidelae, which includes other members of the Delphinieae subfamily.
